title.narrative: OUTPUT 4 - HIV

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, health facilities have equipment, inputs and skills for the treatment and care of children living with HIV and for HIV prevention, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Health]: By the end of 2019, boys and girls aged 0â€“59 months, pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers, particularly those living in the most disadvantaged communities, have access to and use an essential package of high-impact preventive, curative and promotional health interventions, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, health facilities have equipment, inputs and skills for the treatment and care of children living with HIV andfor HIV prevention

description.narrative: UNICEF significantly improved the service delivery of health facilities for children living with HIV, enhancing the Government's capacity and ensuring the provision of equipment.The number of health facilities providing prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) increased from 818 in 2018 to 1,112 in 2019. The number of HIV positive pregnant women identified and enrolled in ART reached 877 in 2019 versus 377 in 2018. Ten PoC (Point of Care) devices were provided to ten additional health districts which facilitated the identification and enrollment of 452 HIV positive infants in ART. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
